answers.author: Cory Fleming
answers.text:
I'm not aware of any open source CRM application available at this time.  Several local govts. here in the US, however, have developed their own in-house application and I'd be happy to put you in touch with a couple of those communities to see how they went about developing their solution.
The number of call agents needed depends on a number of factors including (1) how quickly you want agents to answer the phone, (2) what the call center's hours of operation will be, (3) whether you opt to have an Interactive Voice Response (IVR) system to help answer frequently asked questions (FAQs), (4) what type of service requests you decide to take and how long it takes agents to process those requests, and (5) what volume of calls the government is currently receiving and what the expected volume will be once the new system is introduced.  It's only after you've determined what kind of service you want to provide that you can begin to make some of these other decisions.
And finally, regional 311 systems are exceedingly rare.  There are a number of city-county systems in the U.S. and a few county systems that answer many questions about the services of the municipalities within their boundaries, but I'm not aware of a system whereby several municipalities share costs to provide 311 service to their citizens.

answers.author: Cory Fleming
answers.text:
I'm not familiar with the systems in Costa Rica to know if the phone companies there  can designate a particular number for a centralized call  center -- for example, Canadian cities use 311 and English cities have 101 for this purpose.  Beyond the actual phone number, however, I think any local government can adopt the practices of a centralized customer service system (aka, a 311 service) if its desire to do so is strong enough.  It's a matter of documenting local government business practices and integrating those processes with the technology that gives call agents the access to the knowledge needed to respond to citizen calls for information and requests for service.
